newsitem.title: FRANCE: France may impose economic plan by decree-Le Monde.
newsitem.headline: France may impose economic plan by decree-Le Monde.

text.p: France's new Socialist government is considering implementing its economic recovery plans by decree rather than through a mini-budget, newspaper Le Monde said on Tuesday.

The newspaper said that in order not to disappoint voters hoping for swift change, Socialist Prime Minister Lionel Jospin was looking at the possibility of using decrees to reallocate spending credits without boosting public deficits.
"The (recovery) measures would not be in a mini-budget...but would be taken by decree," the afternoon daily said without citing any sources.
The newspaper said that it "was widely accepted that all the (Socialist) campaign promises would be financed by reallocation of credits without deepening the deficit".
No official comment was immediately available.
The Socialists campaigned last month on a pledge to put economic growth to counter record unemployment at the top of the political agenda.
